stories.original_title: MaliciousCorgi: AI Extensions send your code to China
stories.generated_headline: AI-Powered Browser Extensions Leak Sensitive Code to Chinese Servers
stories.summary: MaliciousCorgi, a newly discovered malware campaign, exploits AI extensions to exfiltrate sensitive code and data, posing a significant threat to global cybersecurity.

stories.original_title: Actors: A Model of Concurrent Computation [pdf] (1985)
stories.generated_headline: Pioneering Concurrency: The Actors Model Revisited
stories.summary: This seminal 1985 paper introduces the Actors model, a foundational framework for concurrent computation that remains influential in modern AI systems. It outlines the model's key concepts and applications.

stories.original_title: Clearspace (YC W23) Is Hiring an Applied Researcher (ML)
stories.generated_headline: Clearspace Seeks Applied Researcher to Advance AI Capabilities
stories.summary: Clearspace, a Y Combinator-backed startup, is looking for an applied researcher to join its team and drive innovation in machine learning. The role promises opportunities to shape the future of AI applications.

stories.original_title: Towards a science of scaling agent systems: When and why agent systems work
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking the Power of Agent Systems: A Scientific Approach to Scaling
stories.summary: Researchers explore the science behind scaling agent systems, shedding light on when and why these systems succeed, and paving the way for more effective AI applications.

stories.original_title: Show HN: My Open Source Deep Research tools beats Google and I can Prove it
stories.generated_headline: Open-Source AI Research Tool Claims Superiority Over Google's Proprietary Solutions
stories.summary: A developer has open-sourced a deep research tool that allegedly outperforms Google's offerings, with the code and methodology available for public scrutiny and verification.

stories.original_title: Are we dismissing AI spend before the 6x lands? (2025)
stories.generated_headline: AI Investment Trends: Are We Pulling the Plug Too Soon?
stories.summary: As AI capabilities approach a projected 6x growth, industry leaders are questioning whether current spending trends are shortsighted. Experts weigh in on the potential consequences of prematurely scaling back AI investments.

stories.original_title: Aging muscle stem cells shift from rapid repair to long-term survival
stories.generated_headline: Muscle Stem Cells' Adaptive Shift: Unveiling the Trade-Off Between Rapid Repair and Longevity
stories.summary: Researchers have discovered that aging muscle stem cells undergo a functional transformation, prioritizing long-term survival over rapid repair, shedding light on age-related muscle decline. This paradigm shift offers new avenues for therapeutic interventions.

stories.original_title: Nano-vLLM: How a vLLM-style inference engine works
stories.generated_headline: Unlocking Efficiency: Nano-vLLM Revolutionizes Large Language Model Inference
stories.summary: Nano-vLLM introduces a cutting-edge inference engine that optimizes performance for large language models, delivering faster processing and improved resource allocation. This innovation has significant implications for AI applications and natural language processing.

stories.original_title: My iPhone 16 Pro Max produces garbage output when running MLX LLMs
stories.generated_headline: iPhone 16 Pro Max Struggles with MLX LLM Output Quality
stories.summary: User reports indicate issues with garbage output when running large language models on Apple's latest flagship device, raising questions about MLX optimization.

stories.original_title: Two kinds of AI users are emerging
stories.generated_headline: The Great Divide: Two Distinct Profiles of AI Users Take Shape
stories.summary: As AI adoption accelerates, research reveals a stark contrast between 'explorers' and 'pragmatists', two distinct user groups with differing attitudes and approaches to artificial intelligence.

stories.original_title: Claude Code is suddenly everywhere inside Microsoft
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Expands Internal Adoption of Claude Code Across Engineering Teams
stories.summary: Microsoft is rolling out Anthropic's Claude Code to thousands of employees, including non-developers, for everyday coding tasks, as part of its broader multi-tool AI strategy. The move signals a significant shift in Microsoft's approach to AI-powered coding assistance.

stories.original_title: "Solving" Wordle from Shared Scores at 100%* Accuracy
stories.generated_headline: Researchers Develop Algorithm to Reverse-Engineer Wordle Solutions from Shared Score Histories
stories.summary: A new study presents a method to accurately infer Wordle puzzle solutions from shared score histories, raising questions about the security of online score-sharing practices.

stories.original_title: Show HN: NanoClaw – “Clawdbot” in 500 lines of TS with Apple container isolation
stories.generated_headline: Breakthrough in Compact Robotics: NanoClaw Redefines Autonomous Manipulation
stories.summary: NanoClaw, a 500-line TypeScript project, showcases a robotic arm's capabilities within Apple's container isolation, pushing boundaries in AI-driven automation.

stories.original_title: MRI scans show exercise can make the brain look younger
stories.generated_headline: Exercise Linked to Younger-Looking Brain Structure in Adults
stories.summary: A new study using MRI scans reveals that regular exercise may contribute to a more youthful brain structure in adults, potentially combating age-related cognitive decline.

stories.original_title: Microsoft is walking back Windows 11's AI overload
stories.generated_headline: Microsoft Reverses Course on Windows 11 AI Features Amid User Backlash
stories.summary: Microsoft is scaling back its AI-powered features in Windows 11, responding to user concerns over intrusive AI elements and performance issues.

stories.original_title: My fast zero-allocation webserver using OxCaml
stories.generated_headline: OxCaml Powers Zero-Allocation Web Server, Redefining Performance Efficiency
stories.summary: "A developer showcases a high-performance web server built with OxCaml, achieving remarkable speed without memory allocation overhead, pushing the boundaries of web development optimization."

stories.original_title: The Reasons Teens Say No to AI
stories.generated_headline: Adolescent Perspectives: Uncovering Resistance to Artificial Intelligence Adoption
stories.summary: A recent survey reveals the top reasons teenagers are hesitant to embrace AI technology, shedding light on the concerns and misconceptions shaping their attitudes. The findings suggest a need for targeted education and awareness efforts to address these concerns.
